dialogues.text: Illuminated with flashlights.  Jonas enters, stares at the Wonderwall, mainly Liza, a moment before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one hour I want to know what she eats, where she sleeps, the name of her gynecologist. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.  Liza enters followed by Jerry.  An awkward beat as Jerry looks suspiciously about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  Home safe and sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there like two teenagers at the end of a date. Liza holds her copy of Conspiracy Theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me an hour; now give me a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, there's something I have to ask you.  Actually about a hundred things, but we can make progress, if you answer one question.  To my satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was that painting.  The one on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I didn't mean for you to see it. It's like looking in someone's diary and taking it out of context.  Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It made me feel like you could see inside of me.  And I don't know how that's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry doesn't answer.  He looks around.  Trapped.  Then he spots a particular doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I, um, could I look at something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning for her answer, he walks into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big enough for a chair, bookshelves and a treadmill. Jerry steps onto the treadmill.  Tentatively, like it might swallow him.  He looks forward, then looks back. At... A framed 8X10 photo on the bookshelf:  Liza, maybe 21 years old, in full equestrian gear holding the reins of her horse -- Johnny Dancer.  She stands beside an older man who surely must be her father.  He's also the "Mr. S" from Jerry's bizarre strobe show. Liza stands in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you 100 bucks if you leave right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps to photo) Is this your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up photo) Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza tries to keep her cool; it's not easy.  Jerry looks from the photo to the treadmill.  It's all suddenly clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's why you punish yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You run with your back to the picture.  Like you were trying to get away.  Once in awhile you sing along with music, but mostly you punish yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes) You watch me, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry realizes he's blown it.  Liza looks out the window, down to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you stand?  In the alley? Do you sit in a car?  Is it every night?  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry counters by pointing out the horse in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Dancer, right?  You don't ride him anymore, do you?  Not since your dad died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.  I know you're crazy, but fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forlorn, Jerry sets the picture back down.  The walls of books reminds him of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a copy of that book I can borrow?  Catcher?  I don't usually go this long without one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza closes her eyes, rubs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your twenty-four hours. Just give me the next eight off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry nods, exits in front of her.  She stays put.  A few moments pass before we hear her front DOOR OPEN and then CLOSE as Jerry leaves.  Liza's eyes flicker over to the treadmill.  A moment and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re:  treadmill) Fuck you, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza turns, switches off the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drizzle has started to fall.  For a street lined with parked cars, it has a rather desolate feel.  There's a certain car -- a Crown Victoria.  A silhouette behind the wheel.  Liza's apartment is being watched.

dialogues.speaker: CROWN VICTORIA
dialogues.text: It's Agent Lowry.  And in the back seat AGENT MURPHY. They sit in silence, a relaxed, practiced state of alert. Murphy frowns at the RAINDROPS which SPLAT the rear window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take a piss in the alley before it starts to pour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowry nods, keeps his eyes on the entrance to the apartment.  Murphy opens the door.  As he climbs out of the back seat, we see a black 9mm in a shoulder harness. A few moments pass.  Agent Lowry leans forward to look up to the dark window of Liza's apartment.  Behind him, he hearts the back door open, Agent Murphy slide in the back seat.  As Lowry leans back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your bladder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barrel of Murphy's black 9mm is pressed squarely against the side of Lowry's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. (cocks hammer) How's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jerry in the back seat!  But Lowry's a pretty cool customer.  He regards Jerry evenly in the rearview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot of folks are looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowry's hand inches toward a .45 on the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must be the smart one. Hands on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little nudge of the 9mm and Lowry does as he's told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.  Where's my partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that.  A gun to your head and you ask about your partner. He's okay.  May have a headache for a few days.  Are you here with honorable intentions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should think of me as Liza Sutton's guardian angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ironic.  Because we're here to protect her from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here because you figured I might show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seemed like a possibility. What about your intentions?  Are they honorable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a violent man, Mr. Lowry. Not by nature, anyhow.  But if you hurt Liza in any way, I'll kill you.  Does that seem honorable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know if --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry creases the back of his head with the gun barrel. As Lowry slumps unconscious, Jerry starts out, then pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you pretending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure doesn't seem so.  Till Jerry cocks back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all but motionless) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry whacks him again.  Jerry's about to go when the front door to Liza's building opens and Liza steps out in her running gear. Jerry crouches, but he needn't bother.  She's not looking his way.  As she takes off down the street:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry pulls Lowry over to the passenger's seat, then climbs into the driver's seat.  He starts the car, then rolls out after her.

dialogues.speaker: LIZA
dialogues.text: runs.  Looks every inch the athlete as she moves.  Her feet splash through the growing puddles as she's off the curb and on the street.

dialogues.speaker: CROWN VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Jerry "talks" to Lowry as he drives, shadowing Liza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shouldn't be outside at night. What's she doing? (looks to Lowry) I know you can hear me.

dialogues.speaker: LIZA
dialogues.text: cuts through a gap in the wall and enters Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: CROWN VICTORIA
dialogues.text: As he stops short, Lowry slams into the dash.  He turns, rides along looking for a place to turn into the park. And then she's gone from sight.  Jerry abandons Lowry and the car in the middle of the street and takes off on foot.

dialogues.speaker: PARK
dialogues.text: Moving between the trees.  Elusive.  Tireless.

dialogues.speaker: PARK
dialogues.text: Gasping.  It takes everything he's got to keep her in sight.  He strips off his jacket to lighten the load.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: As Liza exits the park, continues on her way, unaware that behind her... Jerry collapses against the wall.  Taking each breath like it was his last, he watches as she disappears from sight.  Finally, as he staggers out of the park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry down the aisles.  Getting desperate.  Finally, the classics section.  Moby Dick.  Pilgrim's Progress.  Of Mice And Men.  Bingo!  The Catcher In The Rye.  One copy left.  Jerry grabs it.  Whew...

dialogues.speaker: CASH REGISTER
dialogues.text: The clerk waits as Jerry steps up, hands him the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a long day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk nods, picks up a scanner, runs it over the bar code on the back of the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three bleary-eyed TECHNICIANS sit up and take notice as an alarm goes off on one of several computer screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody bought one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second Technician watches as city grid maps flash across his computer screen.  It narrows to a single street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes and Noble.  McKinley Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tech #3 grabs a radio mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLEET code 115.  Location is 11- 546 McKinley.  Barnes and Noble. Keep collateral damage minimum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk hands Jerry his bag, thanks him.  Jerry starts out.  Throwing the bag in the trash, he's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry walks down the street, reading. A popular area, there are still quite a few people about. Suddenly the pages flutter in Jerry's hand.  Trash swirls at his feet.  He stops, slowly looks up as he hears the HELICOPTER. Black, no running lights, equipped with a sound damper. It descends quickly over the intersection.  Silky black cords drop.  Traffic snarls as CLEET COMMANDOS slide down. Four of them.  Plainclothed with discreet com-headsets. Wearing jackets, we catch glimpses of the equipment slung on their hips, including machine pistols.  Each has a 2X3 piece of paper taped to his wrist.  Like NFL quarterbacks with the plays, except the papers are photos of Jerry. The helicopter is gone so fast some people haven't even noticed.  The commandos disperse into the crowd, refer to their wrists as they advance in Jerry's direction. Jerry hightails it the opposite way, tries not to attract attention.  He pulls up in front of a movie theater as a second chopper swoops in to drop four more commandos at the south intersection.  The street has been sealed off. Jerry stands there a beat, not sure what to do. Something makes him look across the street where CLEET #1 pulls up, looks over at him.  As CLEET #1 refers to his wrist photo, Jerry dashes into the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a hurry.  The skyline whizzes past as Jonas listens in on his headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I repeat.  Target has entered the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oswald tried the same tactic, if I recall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly a full house.  Jerry sits near the front, nervously looking back over his shoulder, watching the aisle. Four CLEETs appear silhouetted at the entrance.  As they start down, checking faces... As the manager drones, people head for the aisles.  Jerry moves for the emergency exit.  Sticking out like a sore thumb as the emergency door opens and a shadowy figure steps inside the alcove.  A CLEET commando. He spots Jerry, starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into com-set) He's in the third theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry starts back through what's been an orderly proceeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb!  There's a bomb in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cry of "Bomb!" gets taken up, panic spreads.  No one gets trampled, but the shoving is fierce.  As the CLEETs fight their way down, Jerry heads for the rear exit.  A few other patrons go that way as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry exits with a solid head-start, but as he turns there's a CLEET in the alley.  Checking faces -- not looking Jerry's way yet.  Jerry keeps close behind another patron, then darts out, swings the CLEET face first into the wall. As the CLEET draws his machine-pistol, Jerry slams his face once, twice into the wall.  As the CLEET drops, Jerry makes eye contact with a woman who watches aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't like his looks.  Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she shakes her head "no," Jerry continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big crowd.  As police cars pull up, the CLEET commandos exchange a look.  Removing their headsets, they disperse, dissolving into the crowd like they were never even here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's asleep.  All seems peaceful.  Then, low WHISPERING. It STOPS, STARTS again.  Low, conspiratorial, cabalistic. Liza tosses, turns in her sleep.  A shadow seems to pass over her.  But as she wakes up, the WHISPERING FADES. Liza sits up, a bit spooked.  She cocks her head, listens.  Was that a click in the other room.  Unsure, she gets up, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Filled with long, dark shadows.  Liza steps out, puts a hand on the light switch.  Steeling herself, she switches them on.  The room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: SITTING ROOM
dialogues.text: Liza sticks her head in.  Empty.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Lights go on.  No one here.  Liza slowly pulls back the shower curtain.  Nothing.  She switches the lights off.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Liza returns from the kitchen, something in her hand. Stepping to the door, she first checks to make sure it's locked.  Then she balances an empty bottle upside down on the knob.  She looks at it a second, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm turning into Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switching off the lights, she exits for the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: as Liza starts up the steps.  Being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two surveillance drones monitor Liza's movements.

dialogues.speaker: SURVEILLANCE VAN
dialogues.text: Someone's watching the watchers.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Observing the van through a pair of binoculars.  It's difficult to say where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry stands at the window, looking through a small telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson looks across his desk to where Liza stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been given a cease and desist on all matters relating to Jerry Fletcher.  We're not to discuss him with the press, the N.Y.P.D., anyone.  Building police are to arrest him on sight and we're to report any attempt he makes to contact you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes perfect sense.  Field work is not our oeuvre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it.  Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jonas thought you might be inclined not to cooperate.  Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know who Jonas is.  We don't know who it is we're cooperating with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had a lot of credentials flashed in my face, Liza.  What I saw yesterday, I know not to ask questions.  We're out.  Shut off. Terminated.  Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza strides down the hall.  LAWYERS, seen earlier in the conference room, are talking.  One looks over as Liza nears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza, settle a bet for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) What do I look like to you? Switzerland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all lean a little closer to the wall, make sure she has room to pass. As Liza passes her secretary, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any messages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing so far, Liza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza enters, she looks at her equestrian photo a moment, then BUZZES the INTERCOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over intercom) Not a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sighing, Liza opens her briefcase, pulls out the Conspiracy Theory newsletter and Jerry's subscriber list. Sitting at her desk, she turns on her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunchtime.  A big crowd on the street.  Among them -- Jerry.  He wears a baseball cap, heads right for the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see the forest for the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds a six inch length of steel rebar and a coil of wire cable.  He passes the van.  No one in the front.  At the rear quarter, Jerry bends down to tie his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRONES hunch over a speaker as a reel-to-reel records.  We hear a TELEPHONE RING, a WOMAN'S VOICE say "Hello?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker) I'd like to speak to Mr. Ketcham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mrs. Ketcham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza's on the phone, unaware it's a party line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Ketcham.  Your husband subscribes to our newsletter.  I'd like to ask him if he'd like to renew his subscription.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they listen, unaware of Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband's dead.  He was killed two nights ago in a car accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one end, the cable is sinched around the middle of the length of the rebar.  Jerry slides the bar through the center hole of a manhole cover.  The other end has a loop which he attaches to the van's undercarriage.  Shoes tied, Jerry rises, continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza crosses the name Ketcham off the subscriber list. There's just one name left:  Henry Finch.  In St. Louis. Liza looks up as her office door opens and Jill carries in a bouquet.  Sunflowers -- seven of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just came for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza opens the car:  Go out front.  Take the westbound bus. Liza stands, grabs her cell phone off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill, I'm expecting a call from  the post office in St. Louis. Transfer it to me when it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drones watch as Liza exits and heads for the bus stop.  As Drone #1 moves up into the driver's seat, Drone #2 makes a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject is on the move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus pulls up and Liza gets on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing the other way.  As it pulls out, the wire unspools.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE MANHOLE
dialogues.text: The wire whips up until the piece of rebar hits the hole.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The 155 pound manhole cover pops loose, bounces along behind the van.  As the van pulls a U-turn, the MANHOLE whips around, SLAMS in the door of a parked car.

dialogues.speaker: VAN
dialogues.text: Drone #1 checks the side mirror, spots the manhole cover bouncing along behind.  He HITS the BRAKES.  The van stops, but the MANHOLE keeps coming.  It SLAMS the rear of the van, tears a three-foot gash before CLANGING to the ground. Drone #2 jumps out, tries to lift the manhole to thread the rebar out.  As he struggles, Drone #1 hits the HORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giving up, Drone #2 gets back in the van.  They take off. The MANHOLE CLANGS along behind them, sideswipes a car. That draws the attention of a police cruiser coming the opposite direction.  As the cherry lights flip on, the manhole takes out the cruiser's windshield. As the van turns the corner, the manhole wraps around a pole.  As the rear axle tears free of the van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry waits as the bus approaches, stops.  Down the street, the cops approach the van.  Smiling, Jerry boards the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry walks to the back, sits beside Liza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the van back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) What van?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  You'd think I was making it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get your subscribers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put an ad on a computer bulletin board.  I log on at the library so I can't be traced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've been tracking them down all morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't been bothering them, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead.  Four out of five anyhow.  All in the last 24 hours. One car accident, two heart attacks and a stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... It's my fault.  They drew a black line over me and now I'm passing it on. (realizes) I'm passing it to you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.  Let's worry about Henry Finch.  P.O. Box in St. Louis.  He's the last on the list. I haven't been able to reach him yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you better not try... I worked so hard to keep quiet. Like a mouse.  I should have realized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realized what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Finch.  That they monitor everything.  That it was only a matter of time.  And now four people are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza reaches into her pocket, takes out the newsletter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaborate on 'they,' okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are all kinds of groups, all kinds of initials.  But they're all part of two warring factions. One:  families that have held wealth for centuries. They want one thing.  Stability. Group Two:  the boat rockers. Eisenhower's military industrial complex.  They want instability. It's a trillion dollar a year business.  When there isn't a hot war, they make a cold one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold War's over, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now they feed us terrorists. To create fear.  How much do you think an airport security system goes for?  Then multiply it by every airport in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think Group One is at war with Group Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latest casualty?  Ernest Harriman. You heard of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. One of the richest men in America until he died a few days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His obituary was in every paper. But not one of them said he was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murdered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here in Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It said in the paper he drowned in a swimming pool.  In Newport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody dies in Newport.  They couldn't even kill Sunny von Bulow there.  Harriman drowned, but it wasn't in Newport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Liza stand amidst the hustle and bustle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.  In the 7th Street subway station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was he doing down here?  A billionaire waiting for the subway?  Why not drown him in a bus?  Why drown him at all?  Why not shoot him?  Is the hitman from the lost world of Atlantis?  I mean, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the big picture and you stumble around in the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're big details, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you watch the news?  Read the paper.  Last week, this whole place was underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A water main broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't break in the summer! Do you know what building is right over this spot?  Harriman Tower. Their sub-basement was flooded! He didn't die in a pool.  Call the coroner in Rhode Island!  Ask if the water in his lungs was chlorinated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's what you want.  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She means it sincerely.  She'll help.  Jerry's touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say. (blurts) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spontaneous moment.  Jerry's barely sure he said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- It's like, I resolve to call you up 1000 times a day.  To ask you if you'll marry me in some old-fashioned way. (shrugs) Everything you do is magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are song lyrics, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.  I'm just -- I'm nervous.  I reached out and grabbed the first thing out there. I know they're song lyrics.  And I know how I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, Jerry.  A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ, here it comes.  Look, I know you think I'm crazy.  I don't think I am, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I reached a point where you didn't think I was crazy anymore?  If I was normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were eating Kentucky Fried Chicken and drinking Coca-Cola again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...  Would you, I mean, could you love me then?  If I was normal.  Maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to yourself.  Jerry. You don't love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.  Since I met you, I don't dream about holes anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holes?  I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday you were wondering about the wall.  How it was possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not really the time to get into this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Geronimo.  Love. It lets you see things.  It gives you insight. I've loved you since the first time I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when was that?  Was it that night I got mugged?  Or was it before then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me.  Was the first time you saw me the first time I saw you? Was it?  You've been following me around.  Do you see how that could be disconcerting to me?  That's not love, Jerry.  It's obsession. And it isn't normal and you can't expect me to respond to it and you can't expect me to feel the same way. (long beat) Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never hurt you, Liza. Think whatever you want, but don't think that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  I know you wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you -- Why -- Love ruins everything, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry starts off through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry?  Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry starts to run. Liza starts after him, but she runs into a commuter, then another.  Jerry's lost in the crowd. The subway is about to leave.  As Jerry gets on, Liza spots him.  The doors close.  The train rolls.  She moves alongside, tries to get his attention, but he won't look over.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY TRAIN
dialogues.text: Jerry finally looks back.  He sees Liza an instant before entering the tunnel, then a row of white strobe lights on the tunnel wall.  Jerry tries to blink them out as the sound of conspiratorial whispers fill the train.  He looks about.  It's all suddenly unreal.  Certain passengers turn their heads, leer at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. S.  Mr. Sutton.  Liza's father.  Standing at a white horse fence.  His BACK TO us as whoever it is comes up from behind.  As a pistol is raised INTO FRAME, the WHISPERING GROWS IN VOLUME.  Mr. Sutton turns and somewhere along the way, it BECOMES A SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza stands there, curses herself as the last of the train is swallowed by the tunnel.  This isn't how she meant things to turn out.  Then, her CELL PHONE RINGS. She takes it from her pocket, flips it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza, we got a call from the P.O. in St. Louis.  The mail for Henry Finch is being forwarded.  Right here to Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same place where Jerry followed Clarke and Piper in the beginning.  As Liza enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The International Fund For Mergers and Acquisitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza steps to the building's directory, slides a finger across.  The Central Intelligence Agency occupies the 18th to the 22nd floors.  Just like Jerry saw.  Liza drops her finger down... The 24th floor -- The International Fund For Mergers and Acquisitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza gets off the elevator, heads over to the door to the I.F.M.A.  What's really behind here?  Liza takes a breath, grabs the doorknob to find out.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A group of bureaucrats pass by discussing interest rates. Liza steps over to a RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Henry Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist looks her over a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he expecting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackpot!  Liza, dropdead official, flashes her credentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ms. Sutton with the Justice Department.  Could you tell Mr. Finch I need to see him at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY leads Liza past cubicles full of clerks going about business.  They come to a door.  Finch.  They enter.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: No one's at the desk, but the door to the adjoining bathroom is open.  Liza can hear WATER RUNNING in the SINK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be right with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary exits, closing the door behind her.  Liza watches the bathroom door, apprehensive as she hears the WATER TURN OFF.  A prolonged moment before ... Dr. Jonas exits the bathroom.  He looks at her, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're as impressed to see me as I am to see you, you're very impressed indeed.  How's Jerry feeling this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza sits across from the desk.  Jonas watches her closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm about to tell you is partially documented.  The Freedom of Information Act saw to that. But much more of it isn't.  For reasons which will soon be regrettably clear, I'm going to share -- secrets -- with you. Repeat any of it and you'll simply bestow the title of 'paranoid' upon yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth'll set you free.  I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas smiles sadly, turns his alumni ring around his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years ago, I worked for the C.I.A. in the M.K. ULTRA program.  Are you familiar with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was mind control.  Manchurian Candidate kind of stuff, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vulgar pop term, but yes.  Take an ordinary man and turn him into an assassin.  That was our goal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask what you can do for your country.  That kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores comment) M.K. ULTRA was terminated in 1973. But not the research. It was renamed.  EX CATCHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in Catcher in the Rye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am impressed.  We used the distinctive cover as a sort of mental flash card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas steps over, his tone growing more confidential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We experimented with hallucinogens.  We used electro- shock to produce a vegetative state.  We conducted terminal experiments in sensory deprivation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in 'resulting in death.'  We pushed the envelope until it wasn't even an envelope anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had any idea what to charge you with or how to prove it, I'd arrest you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  I was a minor missionary, a heretic really.  But where else could a red-blooded American boy lie, cheat, steal and kill with the sanction and blessings of the All-Highs?  Besides, now I'm trying to pay my penance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missionary?  Penance?  You talk about it like it was a religion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was.  It was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas says it almost sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry told me he bit your nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dog.  One I intend to put to sleep.  Extrapolate from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things you're talking about. You did them to Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks at Jonas with revulsion.  A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you continue with your religious experiences?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas smiles, nods in acquiescence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.K. ULTRA, EX CATCHER, it all ended the moment John Hinckley shot Ronald Reagan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't us.  The science had been sold.  Pandora's Box opened. My children were taken from me and employed by the private sector. Jerry was one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat as they consider each other.  We hear the CLOCK TICK on the credenza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry is dangerous.  Jerry has killed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas looks a bit melancholy as he smiles, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belief is immaterial.  What's important is the truth... It's been my job to find Jerry.  I'm very much responsible for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this was a spy novel, your next words would be something like I now know too much to live.  Why are you telling me all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll believe what I tell you next.  Because I need to find Jerry.  And I don't think I can do that without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas reaches into a file on his desk, hands Liza a worn, creased wallet-sized photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you recognize this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a smaller version of the photo of Liza and her father that Liza keeps behind the treadmill.  Liza's stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do recognize it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my father's.  Kept it in his wallet.  He was murdered --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the story.  A federal judge.  He denied a man in prison an appeal for a new trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a man.  Ezekiel Walters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walters had nothing to do with your father's murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas doesn't answer.  Liza looks at the photo.  Jonas' watches -- the observer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they found him, he was holding his wallet. But he hadn't been robbed. (to Jonas) The only thing missing was this photo.  Where did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas picks up a keyring, holds up an odd-shaped key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Jerry's safety deposit box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas is coldly paternal as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry killed your father, Liza. And he's been obsessed with you ever since...  It's not even really his fault.  The blame is mine. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks up at the ceiling, the walls.  Like a bird in a cage as it sinks in.  She blinks out a tear.  Another. No place to hide.  Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all makes sense.  Oh God.  He killed him.  Jerry killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza gulps a breath, covers her mouth with her hand. She's going to be sick. Jonas sees it.  Like he's done it before, he turns his trash can over, dumps the contents, hands it to her empty.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO OF LIZA AND HER FATHER
dialogues.text: TIGHTEN ON it as we hear LIZA RETCH.  Painfully.  Like glass was coming up.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS END OF TELESCOPE
dialogues.text: Jerry on the other end.  He stands at a half-washed window with a bucket of soapy water and a squeegee, stares up the street at ...

dialogues.speaker: BLINDFOLDED JUSTICE
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN the building TO the street.  Two operatives wait in a black sedan.  PAN UP and ACROSS the street.  Two more operatives in a second black sedan facing the opposite direction.  The VIEW SWINGS AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Black.  On a helipad two blocks away.  An eight member plainclothed CLEET unit milling.  The VIEW SWINGS again TO an adjacent rooftop.  Two last operatives stand at the edge, headphones on, scanning the area with parabolic microphones.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Smiles grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least someone's finally taking me seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotting something below, Jerry raises the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: A truck shaped like a slice of pizza pulls up.  As the pizza guy climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Checks his watch, smiles.  Pizza's right on time.  He turns, starts out.  A hand clamps down on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN to include a BIG MAN. As Jerry balls a fist ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing) You call that a clean window?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE DEPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Wilson and Liza and Jonas and various hovering aides sit in silence. Waiting for something to happen.  Liza jumps as the door opens.  WILSON'S SECRETARY steps in with the pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Sutton's pizza, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't order... a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Liza realizes, Jonas is already waving the Secretary in.  He grabs the box, sets it in front of Liza.  She looks at Wilson, then opens it.  Pepperoni.  With a note on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Go to the northeast corner.  Call a cab.  Bring the pizza. (looks up) Then there's a poem. (reading) Roses are red, violets are blue, if the Pope goes to Washington, I would, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Liza hands Wilson the note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody find out if the Pope's scheduled to visit Washington?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As people scramble, Jonas looks across at Liza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're up to it, I'd like to follow him. See where he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, hold on.  I don't think --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I'm game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re:  pizza box) I want this box rigged with a beacon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza exits carrying the pizza.  MOVE WITH her as she heads to the NE corner.  She has no sooner raised her hand when a Yellow Cab pulls up at the curb.  Jerry behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to, lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza hesitates a beat, then gets in on the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab rolls.  A sedan follows; the second pulls a U-turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big box van.  Jonas and Wilson enter.  A dot (the beacon) flashes on a city grid.  They roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving the city grid.  There are other taxis down here, but not so many that they'll be lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT flies.  His SPOTTER is on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling east.  Fender number 1301.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Operatives on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on him.  Seventy-five yards back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson and Jonas listen as the OPERATIVES AND the SPOTTER TALK BACK AND FORTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza instinctively sits as close to the door as possible. Not noticing, Jerry grabs a piece of pizza, eats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good.  Have some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd they like that thing about the pope?  I made it up.  Threw it in there to get 'em going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza doesn't answer.  It's no longer cute.  She anxiously starts to check the side mirror.  Catches herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks away, can barely stand this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?  I wish I hadn't told you what I did.  But I can't help the way I feel.  You don't hold that against me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  That wouldn't be fair.  Where are we going, Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a lot easier for me to show you instead of tell you.  But first things first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry checks his rearview mirror, looking for the car. Liza feigns ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a car following us. Probably another one flanking us the next street over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry leans forward to look upwards through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And somewhere up top, a chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks up as well, her acting convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think they're so smart... Actually, they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1000 feet above.  Tough to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light ahead goes yellow.  The cab speeds up.  Red light.  The car ahead stops.  The cab weaves around, squeezes the intersection just ahead of the cross traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns into the oncoming lane to follow, but is forced back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problems up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got him.  He's headed for the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below and ahead, the Queensboro Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flanking as Jerry thought, they turn left ahead of where Sedan One is stuck in traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the blip, Jonas gets on the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas to ground units.  The helicopter has him.  Hang back and let him think he lost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following orders, they slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn onto the ramp for the bridge.  Headed for the lower section of the double-decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to Queens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch as the Yellow Cab disappears from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bridge.  Lower level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they ZOOM over it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfway across it.  Without warning, Jerry locks it up, whips the wheel around.  Liza screams as the cab slides sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HORNS BLARE.  The cab blocks traffic.  Jerry exits, shouts for Liza to follow.  The grabs the pizza box, joins him at the center guardrail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry climbs over the median, drops over to the other side.  He holds out his hand.  She pauses, then takes it. As she goes over, she drops the pizza box.  She reaches for it, but Jerry pulls her along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it!  I'll buy you another one!

dialogues.speaker: MANHATTAN-BOUND LANES
dialogues.text: already slow with commuters.  Across the lanes, an abandoned car, it's rear end up on a jack. Jerry raises a cautionary hand to traffic, starts across with Liza in tow.  He steps over to the abandoned car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you. (as she hesitates) It's okay.  I'm the one who left it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going, Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connecticut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in Connecticut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry takes her arm, guides her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be mysterious, but you'll know when we get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, behind the wheel, STARTS the CAR.  Suddenly, he stares to the left, transfixed.  Liza follows his gaze, but the only thing apparent are the three red-and-white smokestacks of the Con-Edison plant. But before Liza can ask, Jerry snaps out of it. The front-wheel-drive digs in.  The jack spits loose and the rear end hits the asphalt.  As they blend into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting over the Jersey-end of the bridge, no idea of what's going on.  The Spotter realizes ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drop, see that no more cars are coming off the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stopped in traffic.  The helicopter Spotter on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong.  We're going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Operatives get out of the sedan, rush forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hovering low, deploying its CLEET unit onto the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The abandoned car drives off the bridge.  Jerry and Liza go completely unnoticed.  PULL BACK AS they become a very small needle in a very big haystack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR WHIZZES past the "Entering Connecticut" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry drives.  The RADIO PLAYS SOFTLY.  Liza sits as far over as possible.  Quiet, then finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted Bundy.  David Berkowitz. Richard Speck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The names just hang in the air.  Liza is scared. Finally, curiosity gets the best of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come serial killers have two names, but lone gunman assassins have three.  John Wilkes Booth. Mark David Chapman.  Lee Harvey Oswald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) John Hinkley.  The guy who shot Reagan.  He only had two names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without hesitation) Reagan didn't die.  If he had died, everybody would know what Johnny's middle name was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry smiles, but she doesn't smile back.  As he concentrates on his driving... Liza eases her little cell phone out of her pocket. Holding it at her side, half-turning away from Jerry, she flips it open, turns it on.  Enter a pre-dial code: "WILSON" flashes across the display.  As Liza holds her thumb over the ear speaker-holes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Wilson and Jonas and the team confab, the PHONE RINGS. Wilson's SECRETARY answers it in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wilson's office.  Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she hangs up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza sees the light go out on the phone.  Shit.  She glances at Jerry, hits redial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the PHONE RINGS again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wilson's office.  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to hang it up again when suddenly, Jonas grabs her wrist.  He takes the PHONE, listens.  CELLULAR CRACKLES, ROAD NOISE.  Jonas knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her.  The line's open.  Get a trace on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they go into action...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza sticks the live-line phone between the seat and the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The abandoned car takes the exit for "Bumps River Road."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza sits up, doesn't like this at all.  For the third time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry pulls over, stops alongside the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you figured it out yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza stares into the woods, knows what's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza takes a last look at the cell phone antennae sticking out from the seat and follows Jerry out.  They head into the woods, he a bit behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees thin.  Liza and Jerry step out, start to walk along the side of an old barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you really know there's gold in Fort Knox?  Just because they say so?  We should go to Tennessee and demand to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go.  Send me a postcard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue, Liza nervous as hell.  Her eyes dart ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old well at ground level.  Covered over with boards, some of which are rotten.

dialogues.speaker: BARN
dialogues.text: A plan taking shape, Liza heads toward the boards. Jerry's nervous, can't keep his mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who was the first President to be assassinated? George Washington.  His doctor bled him to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They near the rotten boards.  Jerry's behind and to Liza's right.  She's leading him into a trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a fraternity of secrecy. And anyone trying to expose it is labeled a hopeless paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she's about to skirt the edge of the well, Jerry suddenly leaps forward, grabs her.  She nearly screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry gestures at the rotting boards, thinks he saved her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've fallen down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases her, then stares at the distant silhouette of a house.  She's really scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your middle name, Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry looks over, cocks his head kind of funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  Liza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he takes a step toward her, Liza takes two steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what they told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry shakes his head.  Liza wants to believe him, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you have his picture in your safe deposit box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you the day he died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a horse show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last time you rode, isn't it?  Do you think it was your fault?  Is that why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill my father?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...!  But they trained me to. M.K. ULTRA.  EX-CATCHER.  America works.  Get rid of the crazy people, the lone gunmen, and the system still works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza tries to stop his rant before it takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry.  Please.  You don't understand.  I have to know.  It's all I think about.  Do you have any idea what it's like not to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I know what it's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't give you the details because I can't remember.  I went to court to kill him.  At the Ezekiel Walters hearing.  I was supposed to shoot him at the press conference.  You were there. That's the first time I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Love at first sight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what it was.  All I know is I had a gun in my hand, but when I saw you standing with him, I couldn't do it.  If that's love, it's not so bad. (a beat) I found a part of myself that day. I couldn't go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Jonas.  I didn't know that at the time.  Didn't know who he was. (beat) But I knew inside, whoever he was, he'd send someone else.  So I started watching your father.  I wanted to keep him safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sincerity in Jerry's voice that's hard to ignore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else might call it stalking.  My dad felt it.  He started carrying a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kept it in the side table in the front hallway. (off her look) He showed me.  I visited a few times.  Then one of Jonas's guys visited.  When I arrived, your dad was dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  What do these guys have to do with Ezekiel Walters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walters was their fall guy.  Blow up a building and blame a nut. Create fear.  Don't you see?  Your father wasn't trying to keep Walters in prison.  He was looking into getting him out.  He didn't believe the official story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry looks away, can't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not, Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Because he believed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raw honesty to the words.  Stunned, she only has one question left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get the picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father, he was dying.  He was worried about you.  He took your picture out to look at it.  He called you his baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza starts to softly cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I'd keep you safe.  I took the picture and I've been watching you ever since. (a beat) Please don't cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks at Jerry.  He looks like he's on the verge of tears himself.  She's not afraid of him anymore.  But more important than that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.  They embrace.  Just a lost soul and a lonely one trying to comfort each other.  Suddenly, Liza pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to get out of here.  My cell phone's on.  Back in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll trace it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's okay.  You...  You thought I was bad.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LIGHT
dialogues.text: hits them from the woods on one side. Then from the house on the other.  Jerry grabs Liza's hand to run, but GUNFIRE RIPS into the FENCE beyond them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands behind your head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third light.  This one from a helicopter descending. Blinded by lights, Jerry knows there's nowhere to run this time.  He raises his hands, laces them behind his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step away from him, Ms. Sutton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry squints over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is his gun still in the hall table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get it.  And when you got it, keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closing) Step away, Miss Sutton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Members of the CLEET Unit step in.  Two from either side. They grab Jerry, cuff him and start him toward the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLEET #1 shoves her back.  Jerry dips, drives his shoulder into CLEET #1's back.  He looks back over his shoulder at Liza.  Not worried about himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLEETs pound him.  The chopper touches down, the door thrown open.  As Wilson gets off, Jerry is hustled past him and onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson looks back as the CHOPPER MOTOR REVS, the skids lift off the ground.  In the doorway, Jonas waves goodbye The helicopter rises -- revealing CLEET #5, Clark and Piper standing beyond.  They hold 9mms. As CLEET #5 SHOOTS Wilson TWICE in the chest, Liza turns and runs for the house.  They FIRE at her, then give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry struggles.  Jammed into a corner, he watches after Liza, his face pressed against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've embarrassed me, Jerry. You've made certain people take notice of me who shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's not listening.  He only has eyes for Liza.  Down below, her legs churn her toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've arranged for you to take the blame.  Everyone knows how you've been harassing the poor girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ready to burst) Liza!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't watch, Jerry.  It's a moment without hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chokes it out) You've never seen her run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza disappears as darkness swallows the scene. Helpless, hopeless, Jerry pounds his forehead against the glass.  Jonas watches, amused, till Jerry finds the strength to lunge at him.  As Jerry's driven down to the deck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza turns the corner, runs alongside with CLEET #5 closing.  Liza throws a look back over her shoulder then ahead.  The rotten planking covering the well looms. Liza skirts one side, but CLEET #5 steps right into the middle of it.  CRASH!  As he disappears down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza runs.  As Clark closes, she jerks back the gate to the hot walker, continues as the aluminum bar catches Clark in the teeth.  As he drops...

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER BACK
dialogues.text: Piper steadies his aim on the fence, sites through a scope.

dialogues.speaker: LIZA
dialogues.text: Running away FROM us, but an easy target.

dialogues.speaker: PIPER
dialogues.text: Confident, his finger squeezes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Liza is suddenly blotted out by a big green shape.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Mouth smashed, he's gotten up on shaky legs, only to have the back of his head blown off by Piper.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Piper doesn't get a second chance as Liza disappears from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza hits the front steps.  In stride, she picks up a porch CHAIR, flings it THROUGH a PICTURE WINDOW. Piper follows behind as she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Much to Liza's advantage.  She makes it to the hall as Piper trips over a hammock.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Liza pulls open the drawer of the hall table, fishes out a .38, turns just as Piper turns the corner.  Caught by surprise, he goes down as Liza FIRES all SIX ROUNDS.  She HITS another SIX EMPTY CHAMBERS before she stops pulling the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reloading, Liza looks out through the broken window. It's quiet.  Peaceful even.  The helicopter is gone. Just the CRICKETS.  She disappears back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza goes to the phone on the side table, dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak with an Agent Lowry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is closed for the evening. Is this an emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an Agent Lowry in your New York office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza closes her eyes, sure the answer will be no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens eyes) Then this is a goddamn emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen FROM BEHIND.  A MAN sits in a leather chair reading the paper.  A PHONE on a stand beside him RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering) Lowry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Lowry, it's Lynn Matthews at the Bureau.  I hate to disturb you at home, but I have a Liza Sutton on the phone from the Justice Department.  She says it's an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA ARCS AROUND to reveal FBI AGENT LOWRY.  About 60, paunchy with white hair.  Not our Lowry, but the Lowry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard the name...  Put her through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Agent Lowry waits with phone in hand as technicians monitor the call.  OVER a SPEAKER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Miss Sutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Lowry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Technician nods to Lowry as he switches him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza, what can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man holds the phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open. Lowry, Liza, six "FBI" agents and a building SECURITY GUARD step off.  Badges on jackets, MOVE WITH them as they stride the hallway with purpose. Suite 1203.  I.F.M.A.  Lowry and Liza wait impatiently as the Guard keys the door.  Guns drawn, they burst in.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Stop short. The place is empty. The dividing walls are even missing.  The only thing that's here are some ladders, tarps and painting materials.  Liza is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  They haven't moved in yet.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Strapped to a metal chair in front of blinding white lights.  Only now, it's really happening.  Jonas steps over, an electrode in either hand.  Jerry's chin is down on his chest.  He's already been through the ringer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkey finger.  Shoot Coca-Cola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently, Jonas slides one of the electrodes under his chin and lifts his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else knows what you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry just blinks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza Sutton is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I can't be hurt anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry squeezes his eyes shut.  As tears roll down his cheeks, Jonas fires up the juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looming) I'll be the judge of that.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S HAND
dialogues.text: OVER the CRACKLE of ELECTRICAL CURRENT, the strap snaps taut as Jerry tries to reach through the ceiling for the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sink and dirty mattress on the floor.  Two CLEETs drag in Jerry.  Unconscious, he's dumped on the floor by a narrow heating duct.  They leave, lock the door behind them.  Jerry doesn't move, doesn't make a sound.  A rag doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sounds of the CITY, but it's impossible to tell where we are.  Practically a show, Jonas stares out the window.  A CLEET appears vaguely over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God...  Find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No luck.  As the mystery agents pile back onto the elevator, Liza takes Lowry's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others) Go ahead.  We'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors close leaving just Liza and Lowry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to believe you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza points her father's .38 into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the Deputy Director of the F.B.I.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we have time to fool around like this?  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to move on, but she cocks back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowry shrugs.  He doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gave me away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I was just making sure. So, who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowry looks at her, grimly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find Jerry.  I'm -- Who are you?  One of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks ready to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm, it really doesn't matter. Think C.I.A. and exponentiate. I'm a government employee and I've been watching Jerry for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jonas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's why I watch Jerry.  Jerry's the bait for Jonas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's shown himself.  Why haven't you arrested him or killed him or done whatever it is you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas builds assassins for a living.  Several of whom may be in place already.  We'd like to kill a few birds with one stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think Jerry is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea.  Honest.  What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find him.  Because he'd find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go home.  And don't go to work.  Either one could be bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suggest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She coldcocks him, the .38 across the back of the head. As Lowry goes down, Liza heads for the stairwell.  As she disappears, Lowry gets up, clutching the back of his head.  She should have double-checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he follows) I don't get paid enough for this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for anything, .38 in one hand and a flashlight in the other, Liza walks the hall.  She stops at a door draped with Arson Investigation Site tape.  She wrenches down a nailed 2x4, steps between the others.  Enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza closes the door behind her, shines the light. Debris has fallen through a hole in the ceiling.  Liza steps through the rubble to the Wonderwall. Sooty, singed, partially curled at the edges of the paper it was done on.  Liza shines the light.  She's as taken with it now as the first time. The more she stares at it the more frustrating it becomes.  Fighting back tears, growling back her anger, Liza grabs a corner and tears, then tears again, trying to destroy this thing which affects her so. When she's done, the Wonderwall hangs in tatters.  And as Liza tries to get a hold of herself, she realizes... There's a second painting behind the first. Liza pulls down the tatters of brown butcher paper which made the first.  The second is the POV of a room.  In fact, it's entitled:  "In My Room."  In the b.g., a window.  F.g., a sinister chair with straps, hooks and other exaggerated apparatus for keeping someone sitting there.  Discarded, macabre syringes litter the floor.  A flashing light partially obscures a face reflected in a mirror.  Jonas? The whole effect is unnerving, but tells Liza nothing more.  Until... she takes a second look at the window. It's blocked by three red-and-white-striped bars.  As Liza runs her hand over them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza pulls her BMW over to the side, gets out and goes to the rail.  She stares across at the three red-and-white smokestacks of the Con-Ed plant.  The view through the window in Jerry's room. Liza scans the riverfront buildings on Roosevelt Island across from the plant.  There are only a few that would match and one stands out from the rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few lights burn, all on one half of the building.  A security board at the desk, the doors are chained and padlocked shut.  Liza stops across from a brass inlaid letters which identify it as... "Germaine O. Nicols Mental  ospital." The "H" is missing from "Hospital."  Liza is about to continue when... enlightenment!  Running her hand along, she alters the letters, blacking some of them out: "Germaine O. Nicols Mental  ospital."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ger-o-ni-m-o...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An institutional foods truck unloads.  As the driver passes with the hand truck, Liza slips in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cook grumbles  by. Liza ducks behind a dishwasher, looks across at a roach.  As it twitches an antenna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nurse disappears, turning around a corner.  Liza pads her way along.  Looks into a room.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Three middle-aged men asleep on their backs, mouths agape, sleep obviously no release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charge nurse dozes as Liza creeps by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three WOMEN this time -- two asleep, one rocking back and forth on her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey naw-ne naw-ne.  Hey naw-ne naw-ne.  Hey naw-ne naw-ne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrific sight.  Liza turns from it and into...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY TWO
dialogues.text: She turns right into an ORDERLY.  Standing square, hands on his hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collecting herself, she reaches into her pocket for her ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with the Justice Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she produces and hands over a $100 bill, he eyes the .38 in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see any new patients you've gotten in the last twelve hours. (eyes him eyeing) You can say I threatened to shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you got it covered. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's still lying on the floor where he was left.  But he's starting to stir.  Feeling like he was already dead, maybe even wishing he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orderly leads Liza to a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here.  White guy in his 30s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door and they step into...

dialogues.speaker: ROOM THREE
dialogues.text: There's a white guy in his mid-30s.  He looks up.  Wild. Straight-jacketed.  Not Jerry.  Liza's reached the end of her rope.  She just shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balled up. Fetal. Not really all there. Head pressed to the cement, he tries to sing to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue moon...  Blue moon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza just stands there, leaning on a rail on the wall. The Orderly isn't sure what's going on, but he knows it's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?
