dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza starts down the hall with the Orderly following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got some new patients last week.  You want to see them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza waves them off.  It's hopeless.  She stops at a chicken-wired window at the end of the hall, looks out. Light's about to break and Jerry's out there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I gotta get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, grabs his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks up at the air duct.  Pulling a laundry cart over, she climbs up, presses her ear against the grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Blue moon... Blue moon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry...?  Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear LIZA'S DISTANT "JERRY," but it doesn't register with Jerry.  He's all inside now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue moon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing back) You saw me standing alone ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's eyes open.  He heard that.  Maybe.  He sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a song in my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a love of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Liza sings into the vent, the Orderly thinks he may have a new customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue moon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining) You knew just what I was there for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry moves closer to the vent as the two of them sing their "duet."  She's alive.  It finally, really sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza, now joined by the Orderly, listens as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  North wing.  First floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks to the Orderly for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The north wing's closed off... This way.

dialogues.speaker: GALVANIZED DOOR
dialogues.text: A heavy locking bracket riveted to the door.  The Orderly smacks the padlock with a fire extinguisher.  Once, twice. The lock flies off.  Liza pushes the door open to a dark hallway.  The windows are boarded over. Foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is as far as I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the police down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry has crawled his way over to the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diversion.  Need a diversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands cuffed, he pulls himself up, leans heavily on the lip.  As an afterthought, he stares into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza's coming.  Gotta look sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry runs a hand through his hair, collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLEET on patrol.  He passes a doorway into an abandoned room.  As he turns a corner, Liza steps out of the room, continues the opposite way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His feet braced against the wall, Jerry pulls on a PIPE under the sink.  It GROANS, CREAKS, and then SNAPS. Water geysers up.  Jerry sputters out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza makes her way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLEET GUARD outside a door.  He looks down as water pools at his feet.  Turning, he sees it runs from under the door.  There's a 5x5-inch window on the door, but the view is blocked by a hard, white surface.  The Guard raps the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on there?! (off no answer) Where's the water coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry holds a toilet lid over the glass.  Another RAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOLTS BEING SLID BACK.  Jerry stumbles as the door is pushed open.  The Guard enters, leading with his 9mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to see for yourself, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: sink) Where'd you think that was going to get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard is unaware that Liza has appeared in the doorway behind him.  Jerry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right where we are now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard steps forward to let Jerry have it.  He freezes at the HAMMER CLICKING back on the .38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cursing himself, the Guard lets the 9mm slip to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard turns.  As he does, Jerry raises the toilet lid, cracks it down over the top of the Guard's head. The exertion sends Jerry sprawling, as well.  He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you think?  Is something going on here or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry (armed with the 9mm) and Liza exit.  Liza slides the bolts back on the door.  Footsteps and voices ahead. Jerry leans on Liza as they start their escape in the opposite direction.  They've just disappeared around one corner when Jonas and CLEETS #3 and #4 appear around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the guard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slipping in the water, the CLEETS hurry forward.  One of them looks through the window, scowls as the second unbolts the door.  As Jonas sees the unconscious Guard and the toilet lid, he does not look happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man approaches from one end of the sidewalk.  Flip, the black owner of the newsstand Jerry frequents.  No longer wheelchair-bound.  As he converges with Agent Lowry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old security guard watches a little TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President had left the area only moments earlier and is currently in Germany.  Again, the quake in Southern Turkey measured seven-point-three on the Richter scale.  Thousands are feared missing or dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up as from outside, Lowry shoulders back the door, exposing the chain.  Flip cuts through it with a portable torch.  Lowery bursts through, passing the sputtering old security guard.  The whole entry takes about two seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Liza make their way along.  Ahead, a CLEET crossing the intersection.  SHOTS are exchanged.  Liza and Jerry hug the wall, move back the way they came.  As the CLEET gets on his headset, they duck down...

dialogues.speaker: EAST HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Jerry, who knows where he's going, motions Liza ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few steps and another CLEET ahead.  More SHOTS FIRED and they duck down...

dialogues.speaker: SOUTH HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: Jerry takes Liza's hand and they run.  Left here.  Right there.

dialogues.speaker: EAST HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Flip and Lowry, infiltrate. They exchange FIRE with a CLEET.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTING HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: The GUNFIRE is DISTANT here.  Jonas gets the report from CLEET #4, who gets it over his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's somewhere on the south side of the wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks a beat) I know where he's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas strides away, CLEETS #4 and #3 hurrying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the end, a narrow alcove to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 2-foot by 2-foot sliding door on the wall.  Padlocked. Jerry aims, SHOOTS the lock off.  He opens the door to reveal a dumbwaiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent two years here.  This used to bring the med-cart.  Demerol. Phenobarb.  It's Jacob's Ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry hits a button on the wall.  Nothing.  No power. Liza looks back over her shoulder at distant gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going on back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!  BOOM!  BOOM!  She spins as Jerry FIRES into the wall.  He tears plaster back in huge chunks to reveal the dumbwaiter mechanism.  A looped bicycle chain, running over teeth on a motor below and disappearing up a shaft above. He kicks the bottom loop off the motor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.  I'll pull you up to the fourth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up there and we'll get it back down here for me.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza thinks a beat, then nods and climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, you continually amaze me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Liza freeze.  The voice is close.  Liza starts to climb out, but Jerry holds her back, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geronimo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her back, hauls down on the chain.  The dumbwaiter starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geronimo is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up.  Love gives you wings. You can fly away from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry hauls down again. Liza disappears from view.  He clutches his side in pain.  Then he hauls again.

dialogues.speaker: DEAD END HALLWAY
dialogues.text: CLEETS #3 and #4 advance.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBWAITER
dialogues.text: jerking upwards.  Liza despairing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry!

dialogues.speaker: ALCOVE
dialogues.text: Jerry hauls harder.  Faster.  Hand over fist.  Determined to get Liza out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too good to be true.  Last thing I do.  Like life pounding eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up, up, up, the dumbwaiter goes.  Finally, it won't go any further.  It's out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: DEAD END HALLWAY
dialogues.text: CLEETs #3 and #4 move up.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBWAITER
dialogues.text: The door won't budge.  Liza leans back, FIRES a ROUND at where she guesses the lock should be.  She throws the door up.  The 4th floor.  As she squeezes out...

dialogues.speaker: ALCOVE
dialogues.text: Jerry holds the chain with one hand, FIRES through it with the 9MM.  A tug and 60 feet of chain spools down at his feet.  Liza's away. As Jerry smiles, CLEETs #3 and #4 appear behind him, each FIRING once into his back.

dialogues.speaker: 4TH FLOOR
dialogues.text: Reacting to the shots.  Appalled at what must be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry!

dialogues.speaker: ALCOVE
dialogues.text: Jerry hears her call, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry drops his gun, corkscrews down into a broken heap. His eyes flutter up as Jonas looms over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patient man can accomplish anything.

dialogues.speaker: 4TH FLOOR
dialogues.text: Liza runs.

dialogues.speaker: DEAD END HALLWAY
dialogues.text: CLEETs #3 and #4 turn as Lowry and Flip approach.  As they head down to the end of the hall, Jerry's eyes flicker to the 9MM.  As his hand inches that way...

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: Liza runs, possessed.  Only this time she's running to something and not away.  She stumbles, slams into the wall at the landing, continues.

dialogues.speaker: DEAD END HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Jonas starts back for Jerry, stops short as he sees him, still on the ground, pointing the 9MM at him.  CLICK. Jerry's out of ammo.  Jonas continues toward him.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Liza comes off the stairwell.  Runs.

dialogues.speaker: CONNECTING HALLWAY
dialogues.text: CLEET #3 goes down, SHOT by Lowry.  #4 makes a dash for it, is pursued by Flip.

dialogues.speaker: DEAD END HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Jerry, spitting blood, waits as Jonas calmly sets the barrel of his gun against Jerry's forehead.  The coup de grace is imminent.  Jerry's ready for it.

dialogues.speaker: LIZA
dialogues.text: Lungs ready to burst.  She hurdles #3's body, turns the corner, screaming as she raises her father's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas looks back over his shoulder just in time for a bullet to drill his forehead above his left eye.  He's dead before he hits the ground. And Liza is at Jerry's side.  One look and she knows it isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!  Somebody help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just looks up at her as she cradles his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't die on me, Jerry.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't promise you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cries at the allusion, takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been my best friend for years and I didn't even know you were out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top pocket...  Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza reaches in, pulls out one of the "new" $100 bills. It's bloodstained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when you gave me that?  A hundred dollar bill to get lost? (re:  bill) That's it.  My lucky charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a tear rolls down Liza's cheek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They changed Franklin's portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's a conspiracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know, but he looks a lot more like Rosie O'Donnel than Ben Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza looks at the bill a moment, shakes her head, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Mertz.  It's Fred Mertz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry smiles.  Liza smiles back.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost apologetic) I don't know why I love you.  But I know that I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza lowers her head, her heart stripped bare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sigh) Now she tells me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overwhelmed, Jerry squeezes his eyes shut.  Liza turns back as Agent Lowry appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desolate) Help him.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A madhouse.  Police arriving in droves.  Jerry in the back of the ambulance.  Liza watches, horrified, as his body jerks as they defibrillate him.  The back doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's restrained by Flip and Agent Lowry, tries to fight past them as the ambulance pulls away. Overwhelmed, Liza collapses.  As they hold her up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful day.  Maybe not a bad place to end up after all.  We COME UPON a particular stone, freshly turned earth on the grave.  Jerry Fletcher.  He didn't make it. Liza stands here all alone.  Paying her last respects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) You got away, Jerry.  They'll never find you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes well up with tears.  Liza fights it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep breath) Get a hold of yourself, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last moment and then she turns and walks away.  As she moves, the sound of FOOTSTEPS.  On the FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Lowry strides down the hall, full of purpose.  At an intersection, he's joined by Flip.  The two of them continue, without speaking, to a door.  They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His chest bandaged, tubes running in and out, Jerry looks up as Lowry and Flip enter.  He's weak, but very much alive.  They look at him.  He looks back as defiantly as his situation will allow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip.  Howard Hughes gave you your legs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip doesn't even crack a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made your decision yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaning toward no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your option.  Ours could be to keep you locked up for a very long time.  In case you didn't know it, you're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention the fact that everyone thinks you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you.  We need what you know.  To bring these guys down. Believe it or not, we're on the same side. (as Jerry scoffs) One thing's for sure.  You don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry stares back.  That may be the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.  On one condition.  I want to make sure she's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got someone watching her 24 hours a day.  She --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean.  I want to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then screw you.  I'll rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  You can see her. (as Jerry smiles) But she can't see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowry and Flip turn to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip. (as Flip looks back) You're the closest thing I got to a friend around here.  Tell me something.  You think I'm crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the hell up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pastoral to say the least.  Liza steps from her BMW, leans against the fence and watches as three lO-year-old girls on horses receive a riding lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza moves along the well-maintained stalls.  One particular HORSE WHINNIES excitedly as she approaches. Liza stops to look him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D., I'm back.  If you'll have me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He WHINNIES, stomps a hoof.  Liza hugs him around the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse has to be the fabled Johnny Dancer.  Their moment is broken up by a rough-looking GROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a saddle around here? This is my horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen you here before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza reaches into her jeans pocket, pulls out her trademark denomination:  a $100 bill.  But something hesitates inside her.  She rubs her thumb over Franklin: Rosie O'Donnel or Fred Mertz?  She pockets the bill, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you help me out?  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; softens) I think I can find a saddle for that horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulled off the road. A view to the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry sits with Lowry and Flip, scans with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see her car, but -- Oh...

dialogues.speaker: LIZA
dialogues.text: Riding Johnny Dancer out into the ring.  She canters back and forth.  Tentative at first, but gaining confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza pulls up, eyes a fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deciding, she whispers something into Johnny's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geronimo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're off at a gallop.

dialogues.speaker: LIZA
dialogues.text: Picking her spot, Liza guides Johnny up and over.  Fluid. A thing to behold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, holding his breath, lets it out in a long sigh, the sound of love.  He smiles sadly, lowers the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's okay. (to Lowry; grim) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It rolls down the road.  Destination unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza gallops out into the sun.  Feeling it, remembering, realizing just how much she missed this.  But now she has it again.  A gift. Head back, she holds her arms out in hope and faith, very much like the painting on Jerry's Wonderwall. FREEZE FRAME.
